"Upon arrival you will be welcomed by our representative who will transfer you to your hotel " "in Lima's Miraflores District. The hotel will be accommodated with a full bar and restaurant. " "The hotel will also be surrounded by vast markets. You should also check out the Larcomar " "Shopping Center located on the boardwalk in from of JW Marriot Hotel." "

When you are finished shopping and want to be adventurous, you have the " "choices of paragliding over the Pacific Ocean bike riding around Lima's cultural districts or " "go for a cliff-top walk that offer fabulous views of the Pacific Ocean."

"In the morning, you will visit the Bohemian district of Barranco, where streets are lined with traditional casonas " "(colonial-style houses), here you will find art galleries and handcraft such 'Dedalo'.

" "Then, you will head to downtown for a walking tour. Founded in 1535 by the Spanish conquistador, Francisco " "Pizarro, it was from Lima that all Spanish territories in South America were governed. Few cities at that time could " "rival Lima's power, wealth and opulence. However its glory days ended in 1746 when the city was virtually destroyed " "by an earthquake. Many of the colonial buildings were rebuilt and you will get a first-hand look at several of them on " "the tour. The striking Plaza Mayor (Plaza de Armas), flanked by some of the most important buildings in town such " "as the cathedral, the huge Government Palace and the Archbishop's Palace, constitutes the heart of the city. You will " "visit the nearby San Francisco Monastery, with its catacombs containing some 70,000 human remains. Next we will " "visit the Central market where we will take a walking tour. The market has a huge variety of fresh produce on offer " "including fruits, vegetables and even Guinea pigs. You will have the opportunity to try some local Peruvian fruits and " "street food. Then to China town which is close to the Market. The tour will finish in Lima main square. " "Then, you will head to Callao district for a graffiti tour. You will spend a different afternoon walking through the " "recognized streets of the neighborhood; you will see art, gastronomy, history, graffiti and local culture. Lunch is " "included in a local restaurant.

" "Then, you will return to the hotel. Rest of the afternoon will be free.
" "Dinner is included in a local restaurant.
" "Overnight - El Tambo Peru 2 or similar: www.eltamboperu.com
" "Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner"

"You will travel 46 kms outside of Lima to visit this very interesting project. This family owned agro-ecological farm of " "3.8 hectares, was created as an alternative to conventional agriculture through the implementation of ecological practices. " "The farm supports small local producers on a system based in the integration of agriculture, livestock " "and fruit trees production it follows principles of productive diversification applying techniques of ecological " "agriculture, ecological management of soils and ecological pest management. Return to Lima in the afternoon."
"Today you will visit a local university in Lima and interact with a group of students."

"At proper time you will be transfer to the airport for your departure to Cusco. At the arrival in Cusco, our " "representative will you transfer to your hotel in Cusco. Lunch will be delivered at the hotel.(Tourist Menu). " "

" "13:00 PM CITY TOUR + RUINS" "

" "Get to know the city of Cusco, an UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site and possessor of a style all its own. The tour " "begins at the Koricancha Temple, an old Incan palace and main center for the worship of the sun god, Inti. Once the " "Spanish conquered Peru, the Dominican order built a lovely church over this temple's foundations: the church of " "Santo Domingo, that is still there today. Your next destination is the Main Square, and then the adventure continues " "at the Sacsayhuaman Fortress built of enormous stone blocks expertly shaped by the Incas. It is strategically located " "at the top of a hill overlooking the city of Cuzco. The tour continues with visits to three archaeological sites: Qenko, " "Puca-Pucara, and Tambomachay, important religious and administrative centers for the Incas. Finally you will visit " "the art workshop named Inkas Expresion, that presents artists working on silver pieces and painting in wood. It is an " "ideal place for the ones that like Andean art." "

" "Dinner is included at the hotel (Tourist Menu)
" "Overnight - Imperial Cusco Hotel: http://www.imperialcuscohotel.org/
" "Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner"

"At proper time you will transferred to the train station. Awaiting you today is by far and away one of the high points in " "world tourism: Machu Picchu. Your adventure starts on a train ride to the city of Aguas Calientes, where you will " "disembark and then board a bus that drives you to the actual Machu Picchu archaeological site, where you will " "definitely have an experience you will never forget. The tour includes every nook and cranny of this New 7 Wonder of " "the World and UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site; afterwards, there is some free time for you to explore the site " "on your own, to relax or to meditate. At proper time you will go to Aguas Calientes town to have lunch which is " "included, after lunch you will have to go the train station in order to departure to Ollantaytambo, at the arrival to the " "train station you will be transfer to your hotel in Cusco.

" "Dinner is included at the hotel (Tourist Menu)
" "Overnight - Imperial Cusco Hotel: http://www.imperialcuscohotel.org/
" "Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner"

"At proper time, you will be driven by bus to Puno, so you can enjoy the wonderful scenery on the way. First you will " "visit Andahuaylillas, a town where a precious church from the 17th century boasts an amazing organ decorated with " "angels and cherubs. After this you will visit Racchi ruins, known as 'The Temple of God Wiracocha'. The last stop " "before arriving to Puno will be La Raya, highest point on the road between Cusco and Puno from where we will get " "excellent photo opportunities. After this you will arrive to Puno.
" "Lunch in a local restaurant is included.
" "Dinner is included at the hotel (Tourist Menu)
" "Overnight - Hacienda Puno www.hhp.com.pe
" "Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner
"

"The trip begins early as you head out of the city of Puno towards the Uros Islands, whose inhabitants are hunters " "and gatherers and handicraft vendors as well as descendants of the first altiplano residents. After an hour on these " "particular islands learning about the life of the residents there, you will sail over to Amantani Island, located at an " "elevation of 4150 meters and whose culture can be traced back to Pre-Incan times. Upon arrival, you will be " "welcomed by the family at whose home you will be staying. You will eat lunch there and then visit the Pacha Tata " "ceremonial center, famous for its mystical energy. You will lodge on the island for the night.

" "Overnight with local families.
" "Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner
"

"After your breakfast, you will take an hour boat ride to Taquile Island, whose highest mountains are 3950 m. The " "culture on the island is old, dating back to Pre-Incan times. The islanders still live according to the traditions and " "beliefs of their ancestors and are world renowned for their lovely outfits and incredible textiles. In fact, UNESCO has " "declared the textile art of Taquile Island as a Masterpiece of the Oral and Intangible Heritage of Humanity. After " "sharing some time with the islanders and standing in awe of the lake setting, you will return to the city of Puno." "

" "Dinner is included at the hotel (Tourist Menú)
" "Overnight - Hacienda Puno www.hhp.com.pe
" "Meals included: Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner
"

"Transport to airport to take your flight to Lima. End of Services.

" "Meals included: Breakfast"

"Welcome to Lima!

" "Enjoy the amenities in and around your hotel.
" "This includes:
" "-shops
" "-bars
" "-restaurants
" "-ocean front"

"Have fun in the Bohemian district of Barranco! Venture to downtown Lima. Enjoy the " "culture and markets with fresh produce where you have the opportunity to buy vegetables " "and even try Guinea Pig!"

"After a relaxing drive to a small farm 'Casa Blanca', walk about the agro-ecological " "farm of 1 hectare. Help the locals tend to the farm and bask in their agricultural world! " "Here you can try some fresh vegetables, especially green lima beans or 'habas'."

"Greet yourself to some fellow Peru students at the private college 'Universidad San Ignacio " "del Loyola'. Try discussing these topics:
" "-Peru's History
" "-Education System and College Life
" "-Local traditions, music and customs"

"Get to know the city of Cusco!

" "This is an UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site and processor of a style all its own. " "Visit Koricancha Temple where the sun god, Inti, is worshipped. Then travel over to Cusco " "where you will have dinner and end your day."

"Train ride to Machu Picchu!

" "At the top of every world traveler's list is this breath taking destination. " "Listed under one of the seven wonders of the world as well as another UNESCO " "World Cultural Heritage site, Machu Picchu offers vast sight seeing throughout " "the region."

"Cusco to Puno: Lake Titicaca

" "Enjoy the bus tour from Cusco to Puno, where you will be able to see more breath taking " "sites and visit small shops and other markets along the way. Look out for wildlife on the " "way. Alpacas, guinea pigs and birds inhabit the vast landscape."

"Lake Titicaca: Uros Islands and Amanti Island

" "The trip begins heading from Puno to the world's highest lake, Lake Titicaca." "Elevation reaches 4130m (~13,500ft). Air will be thin so take a deep breath and emerge " "yourself in adventures and conversations with the local tribes. Here you will lodge overnight " "with a family.
" "Remembering:
" "-May be shared drop toilets
" "-May not have showers, if they do, they are cold
" "-If you are cold, ask for more blankets
" "-Small gifts are highly appreciated"

"Lake Titicaca: Taquile Island

" "After breakfast, rest on the boat ride over to Taquile Island to meet more indigenous tribes. " "The islanders still live according to the traditions and beliefs of their ancestors, so be respectful. " "After sharing some time with the islanders, we will return to you to your stay in Puno."

"Puno to Lima to Florida: Last Day!

" "Today you will have an early start to catch your flight back to Lima, departing from the Juliaca Airport " "near Puno. We will fly to Lima, vist the Pueblo Libre district, founded in 1557. After lunch we will visit " "the National Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology of Peru. Engulf all the information you can, because you " "will depart on an international flight back to Ft. Lauderdale Airport in Florida."
